definitions: Divided (an area) into zones, especially for planning purposes.
Assigned (a property or area) to a particular zone.
Entered a state of mental focus or detachment; became engrossed or spaced out.
examples: The city council zoned the new development for residential use.
The property was zoned for commercial purposes.
He zoned out during the long lecture.
She zoned in on her work, ignoring the distractions.
